Posts.Content: I have been on Arimedex for 9 months now and I think I have just about every side effect listed!  I was told that I may have hot flashes and some joint pain, but none of the rest.  The long and short of it is that I am miserableand don't like the person I've become or the person Arimidex has made me.  Oncologists put you on this stuff because it will hopefullly prevent recurrence but I'm beginning to think the cure is worse than the disease.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Jul 29, 2016 5:01 PM bonnielovell wrote: On Oct 25, 2007 12:00 AM avaava wrote:   On 10/4/2007 Barb g wrote: I wanted to give you all an update on my hot flashes and what I am doing for them in the hopes that it will help someone else.  Have been on Arimidex for 10 months. The hot flashes were terrible so someone recommended Black Cohosh. I have been taking it twice a day for the last month and I have to admit that it really  has helped. It hasn't stopped the hot flashes totally but it has significantly cut them by about 70%. One additional side effect that has occured lately is swollen ankles. Not always but some days are better. Has anyone else had this. I'd be curious to find out if it's just me or the meds. Thanks for listening. Barb G I was diagnosed with breast cancer; had a masectomy, and breat reconstruction.  My oncologist prescribed Arimidex for my cancer treatment.  I advised him I was taking Black Cohosh to help with hot flashes.  Seven months after my breat cancer surgery & treatment, I decided to get a second opinion which turned out to be one of the best things I have done for myself since being diagnosed with breast cancer.  The second opinion dr. was very concerned that I was taking Black Cohosh.  Her response was something very similar to:  "I know you are here for a second opinion and I will be happy to take you as a patient, but whatever you decide, I beg of you to stop taking black cohash.  You are taking medication to take the estrogen out of your body and then you are putting it right back into your body by taking the black cohosh which is a natural form of estrogen."  Needless to say, I stopped taking the black cohosh and I did change drs.  I am very glad I went for the second opinion.  She is a wonderful dr.  So, I would ask you to please stop taking the black cohosh. I am new to this site but thought I would share that I take fish oil capsules for my hot flashes which were severe. It has almost eliminated them completely. Worth a shot for anyone who cant take the flashes. As for bone and joint pain, I really don't know what to do about that:( Mine are awful. I was taking fish oil long before I started Arimidex but my hot flashes are so bad that I can soak through a shirt in minutes!  As for the joint pain, it was suggested that I take glucosimine/chondroitin but that didn't work.  I absolutely hate taking a lot of other pills just because of the side effects one little one.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: It is amazing how many of us have the same side effects that can be lumped into one thing, loss of quality of life.  When I told my oncologist I'd had enough, she tried to talk me into staying on it.  I told her that she could take it and suffer the side effects then tell me they weren't so bad.  No response.  What I can tell you though is that it will take 4-6 months before all of the side effects go away because the half-life is so long.  I just thought you ought to know, from someone who's been through it.  If I were to guess, your doctor didn't, and won't, tell you that.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Good evening!  I saw the oncologist today.  She asked me how I felt and I thought it was a stupid question.  I am off Arimidex, how do you expect me to feel?  My last dose was on August 4, 2016, a date I remember as well as the date I was diagnosed with breast cancer, May 19, 2015.  It has been 6 months now and I have my quality of life back, along with no longer soaking a shirt, sweat doesn't drip off my nose and face, I sleep through the night, no overwhelming fatigue, hot flashes so bad you could grill a steak on me follwed by chills, mood swings so bad I didn't even know myself, depression, weight fluctuations, not being able to open a jar without help, cough, and a scratchy throat.  Now, for the lingering side effects: numbness in my feet, pain and stiffness in my hands, and back; and no longer looking like I was snatched bald-headed, but at least my hair is beginning to get a bit thicker.  One little white pill did all of that!  With each side effect I rattled off, the oncologist just nodded.  After all of this she tried once again to convince me to resume the drug because I hadn't done radiation.  I refused radiation because the cancer was in the left breast and my heart is under that breast.  I don't want to run the risk of damage to my heart.  Do I want to suffer heart disease because of radiation, because of breast cancer?  At this point my answer is no.  At the end of the appointment she said that since my first year mammogram was negative and I had taken Arimidex for the better part of a year, I was better off than never having taken it at all.  We have to speak up and not let doctors make all of our decisions.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Jul 11, 2018 5:25 AM Spidlep wrote: On Sep 30, 2017 10:42 PM Jademtn wrote: On Jun 22, 2014 5:08 AM jupiterjo wrote: Hi there, I'm new to this site, just looked up "joint pain w/ armimidex" and found it, I had double mastectomy in 2013 followed by chemo, no radiation; have been on arimidex now about 6 1/2 months, joint pain in my hands and bone pain, my next oncologist appt. is July 10, I'm curious if I could quit this and get on with my life, I'm a very positive/optimistic person (yes there have been rough/down days, as everyone who's had cancer can attest to) but this has really slowed me way down, I thought it was just me, sometimes I fell like I'm 90 (I'm 54) thanks for listening - Jo  I had Stage 1, IDC, followed by partial mastectomy.  I had no limph node involvement. Quit radiation after 9 (of 30) sessions, no chemo.  I've been on Arimidex at a half-dose level for 4 years now.  I have very few side-effects, mostly dry skin and some bone-thinning.  I work with a distant oncology-trained acupuncturist.  I've never met him as we talk on the phone and he order comprehensive lab-work to look deeply at my 'terrain', i.e. my body that allowed the cancer to grow. He presented the option of using a half-dose in order to receive the benefits with fewer drawbacks.  We do lab-work a couple of times a year to verify that my estrogen levels are undetectable.  I asked my oncologist about this option and he said only "it doesn't work that way!"  I think that meant that standard cancer treatment is not yet actually customizable for different bodies.  But the acupuncturist made clear to me that the point of aromatase inhibitors is to drive estrogen levels to zero.  So, I feel confident that I am doing that with less medicine onboard.  Of course, the acupuncturist is extremely careful to present options without advice.  We're all doing the best we can with this situation.  Just wanted to note an 'outside the box' option that I've never seen on any of these boards.  My approach is a bit of a hybrid. Outside of 1/2 dose arimidex, I rely on enormous immune boosting 'alternative' therapies for now.  Fingers crossed.I was on Arimidex for 2 1/2 years. Before the Arimidex I took 33 rounds of Radiation.I had severe hot flashes.. Joint pain along with night sweats. I was tired all the time. The pill didn’t work my breast cancer returned. And in February of this year 2018 I had a double Mastectomy. Tomorrow I go for my 6 mth check up at the Oncologist. Fingers are crossed that all is good.. two times with cancer is to many. I’ve noticed that my hair has been coming out pretty much everyday when I brush it. And I have very long hair. I don’t know if it’s normal but it is. I hope that stops soon. I’m not on the Arimidex now I guess I will know more about that tomorrow. Time will tell... I hope, and pray, you are now clear.  I only took Arimidex for 10 months because I couldn't handle the side effects.  One of those was losing and thinning of my hair.  The funny thing was that that side effect didn't start until after I stopped Arimidex!  Now that I've been off for almost 2 years, my hair is still more thin than it was before being put on the drug.  If I had it to do all over again, I wouldn't have taken my oncologist's word for it and not gone on it.  She never told me about that side effect and neither did my pharmacist.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: It's amazing what they don't tell you before you're put on this drug.  Half-life is very real but that is for one dose!  You go along fat, dumb, and happy and all the while the drug keeps building up in your system.  As for me, if there were 15 side effects I had 10 of them.  It got down to the fact that I was just plain miserable and after 10 months I'd had it so I just stopped it.  The oncologist wanted me to go back on it and I told her that if she, all of her staff, the drug peddler, researcher, and manufacturer went on it, then I would go back on it.  The look I got!  It's easy for them to say, "here, take this and it'll protect you."  I sound like Bill Cosby and I don't mean to.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: This is an update to my post of Aug. 6. Since the "half-life" of Arimidex is 50 hours, it takes a long time even to begin to get out of your system.  Having said that, it took more than 2 weeks before I began to feel like ME.  Since then, most of the side effects I was experiencing are gone, but some still remain!  The doctor suggested I take a 2-month "vacation" from the drug, but one month almost "clean" and I can't see going back.  Sadly, at this point, I think I'm going to take my chances and stay drug free.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: I am sorry that you are still experiencing pain 5 years after Arimidex.  As for my bone pain, I've kind of gotten used to it but I'll admit that this morning when I got up, I didn't hurt! I am also sorry that you have breast cancer, again.  I sincerely hope that you can tolerate Aromasin better but so many of these drugs have such bad side effects that doctors don't tell us about.  I've come to believe that these oncologists are told by drug reps. (or whomever) to just "stick with it..." but they are not the ones taking these drugs or experiencing the side effects.  Perhaps they, the drug reps., manufacturers, and researchers should take these drugs for 5 years, then perhaps they would do something about the side effects and come up with better drugs.  In re-reading my post I sound bitter and I guess I am.  I'm not bitter because I have cancer but bitter over the drugs and the doctors who push them.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Well, I have good news and bad news about Arimidex.  The good news is that the side effects do go away, the bad news is that the half-life is long, very long, 50 hours.  The half-life is the length of time one half of the dose takes to get out of your system.  What that means is that after a little longer than 2 days only ½mg is gone and since you've been on it for 5 years, it will be a while before the side effects are gone.  I was on Arimidex for the better part of the year and it took almost 6 months before I could say I felt better.  Onto another 5 years of Arimidex.  In the latest literature in the New England Journal of Medicine, it states that "women who have less risky cancers will probably be less inclined to pursue these longer durations and women who have higher risk cancers will be more inclined."  A study done in Quebec with Letrozole (Femora) AI (aromatase inhibitors), "for women who already tolerated five years of an aromatase inhibitor, ... can expect a preserved QOL."  When I read about 5 vs. 10 years and the word "tolerated," I thought "you mean someone is actually listening to us?"  For me, my QOL on an AI was horrible!  I have 3 dogs and they wanted a mom transplant because I was miserable and I know they were!  I hope this helps.  Remember, it's our bodies and we should speak up.  As I've said before, they can't hold me down and force the pill down my throat.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Aug 01, 2018 8:19 PM vadvatta wrote: Janna you are so right it is so easy to say take this my doctor got so mad when I refused the Arimidex it looked like he wanted to slap me.LOL "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://me.LOL " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">me.LOL but he looked at my neighbor sitting next to me an decided to keep quiet. Well after two and a half years it did come back but I was on something else in the begining of that time but coinsedently i got off of that too so Ill never know because since it metastisized iam on the hormone blocker foslodex..having many bone problems...I believe someone on this site mention to look on another site for the statistics on Arimedex you know my doctor said it was just a 15 percent of the cancer not coming back does anyone know if this is true? he never told me it was a sure thing or I would be on it. So I feel like you ladies may be doing good all on your own.As "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://own.As " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">own.As for me I was stage three and 18 positive lymphnodes so there wasnt much hope there and still Iam here since 2015. But I guess we can see why he was angry but if he had my bones he would have understood after 35 rounds od radiation and four chemos its not like i didn't try oh plus the surgery twice found it under my right arm in March so 10 more It seems to me that my oncologist quoted the same statistic, 15%.  I'm a funny old coot, I make up my own mind and don't let the doctor do it for me!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Aug 01, 2018 9:19 PM delaura wrote: I am 76 yrs old Double mastectomy 6/15.  I tried armidex for 2 yrs and switched to femara. I am still stiff with femara but not as bad.  Hot flashes continue.  I am very tempted to stop the medication but haven't as yet. I do feel femara is a better approach than armidex. Delaura  You want the bad news about Femara?  It has almost the same side effects as Arimidex and the first one is hot flashes, join/bone/muscle pain is the fourth, different from Arimidex(Anastrozole).  To be honest, if the doctor and/or pharmacist told us all the side effects, we wouldn't take anything.  I know when I was prescribed Anastrozole, I was not told anything, and I mean nothing!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Aug 02, 2016 1:18 PM EvWallace wrote: On May 21, 2016 12:11 AM Ragsmom wrote: this blog has given me much food for thought. I have been on Anastrazole for only 3 1/2 months. My biggest challenges are bone pain, and cramping, which are significantly more challenging at night; and sleeplessness. I also have a low libido and vaginal dryness. Being post menopausal, I had previously had trouble with dryness and lack of sex drive. Now it's much worse. But the bone pain worries me most. I have an elevated blood calcium level, which the doctor is watching, and osteopenia, which I Discovered at the same time as my breast cancer diagnosis. I plan on talking with my doctor, now that I understand there may be other drugs that might not make me feel quite so bad. I also had bone pain on Aromasin.  My oncologist switched me to Letrozole.  No more bone pain.  Only bad side effects are hair loss and slight weight gain.  Ask your doctor to switch you to another medication.  Good luck and God bless. After 10 months on Arimidex it so affected my quality of life that I was not the same person I'd been before that little white pill.  The doctor wanted to switch me to another drug but I refused. She said, "you do know that Arimidex is a preventative, right?" Duh. Interestingly, their first reaction is to give you more drugs to counteract the side effects of one little pill. Why should we be taking more pills because of ONE? I refused to take Arimidex one more day! What are they going to do, hold me down and ram it down my throat? This time I will think long and hard whether I want to be on ANY drug. Yes, I have breast cancer; no, I don't want it to return; and yes, I will do my research before I start another medication. When/if I do start another medication, I will keep track of my side effects, just like I did with Arimidex.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

So I feel like you ladies may be doing good all on your own.As "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://own.As " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">own.As for me I was stage three and 18 positive lymphnodes so there wasnt much hope there and still Iam here since 2015. But I guess we can see why he was angry but if he had my bones he would have understood after 35 rounds od radiation and four chemos its not like i didn't try oh plus the surgery twice found it under my right arm in March so 10 more It seems to me that my oncologist quoted the same statistic, 15%.  I'm a funny old coot, I make up my own mind and don't let the doctor do it for me!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: I am very happy for you, I truly am; it sounds like you've beat this thing.  Unfortunately for me, after 10 months, the list of side effects were so horrible that it made my quality of life unbearable.  I went down the list and I had 10-12 of the side effects.  When I saw the oncologist, I said that I had this side effect, she nodded her head, next side effect, she nodded her head, and so on down the list.  This went on and on until I finally said, "can you give me several compelling reasons to stay on Arimidex (Anastrozole)?"  She couldn't.  Therefore, I am off the drug and, yes, I will take my chances, hoping and praying the cancer does not return.  What I kept thinking about though were the numbers.  They refer to the group, not the individual; I am only one person in the millions who have had breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Oh Lord, I am so sorry. All of these side effects from 1-1mg tablet of Arimidex. What is really worriesome, is that neither our doctors nor pharmacists tell us what can/will happen when we take this drug. My question is: why? The last time I saw my oncologist, she wanted me to go back on it and I told her she would have to give me 14 good reasons WHY I should and she couldn't; so I'm not going back on it. Oh btw, the last time they had a "dump your drugs" day, guess what I got rid of?
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Congratulations for being on Arimidex for 15 months, you've lasted longer than I did. I've had my moments with some memory problems as well. Speaking of, if memory serves from college, HCG is a human hormone produced by babies to make them grow. My guess is that homeopathic drops cannot actually contain HCG because it would have to be administered by a physician. I'm not a fan of WW because of the way their program works, or doesn't. Have you tried keeping a 3-day diary(don't cheat on it) of everything you eat. We had to do that and there wasn't one person that wasn't surprised at what they put in their mouths and weren't aware of. Try that, be honest, and go from there. Going out to eat is a huge ding to anyone's diet. People don't realize what that Subway or Whataburger is in calories but it is shocking. We won't even talk about putting all the fixins on it. There was just a blip the other day about diet sodas and they don't actually help with weight loss. What helps, a lot, is water. What concerns me is that these drug companies, doctors, and pharmacists don't, or won't, tell us what the immediate and long-term side effects of these drugs are. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: It's amazing what they don't tell you before you're put on this drug.  Half-life is very real but that is for one dose!  You go along fat, dumb, and happy and all the while the drug keeps building up in your system.  As for me, if there were 15 side effects I had 10 of them.  It got down to the fact that I was just plain miserable and after 10 months I'd had it so I just stopped it.  The oncologist wanted me to go back on it and I told her that if she, all of her staff, the drug peddler, researcher, and manufacturer went on it, then I would go back on it.  The look I got!  It's easy for them to say, "here, take this and it'll protect you."  I sound like Bill Cosby and I don't mean to.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

I am still stiff with femara but not as bad.  Hot flashes continue.  I am very tempted to stop the medication but haven't as yet. I do feel femara is a better approach than armidex. Delaura  You want the bad news about Femara?  It has almost the same side effects as Arimidex and the first one is hot flashes, join/bone/muscle pain is the fourth, different from Arimidex(Anastrozole).  To be honest, if the doctor and/or pharmacist told us all the side effects, we wouldn't take anything.  I know when I was prescribed Anastrozole, I was not told anything, and I mean nothing!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Something that no one has posted, that I've seen, are the long-term side effects of Arimidex. After 10 months on the drug, the side effects became too hard for me to handle BUT 2 or 3 months after I stopped I developed pedal edema, something I have never had.  My primary put me on Lasix to get rid of the water (swelling); it took 2 weeks before my feet and weight got back to normal. Then it would come back again and again. When I saw the oncologist, I asked her but she just shrugged it off and I don't know if it's because she didn't know (which I doubt) or was surprised I could connect the dots. Anyway, I happened to ask another doctor in passing about Arimidex and pedal edema so he looked it up on his PDA and guess what? Pedal edema is a long-term side effect of Arimidex! I don't believe for a New York minute that I am the only one who has connected the dots or experiencing this; anybody else?
Posts.Title: Long-term side effects of Arimidex
